We are an inclusive group driven by our intellectual curiosity and sense of purpose.
Join us to use Earth science, decision science, data science, and engineering to address critical societal challenges!

### Undergraduates

There is support for motivated undergraduates to work for pay or credit.
See the lab guide's [instructions for prospective undergraduates](https://dossgollin-lab.github.io/lab-guide/joinus/undergrad.html){target=_blank}.
:::
::: {.g-col-4}
### Graduate Students

In light of the evolving federal science funding landscape, we are not actively recruiting graduate students at this time.
Students with external funding are welcome to apply.
:::
::: {.g-col-4}
### Postdocs

We are not actively recruiting a postdoc at this time.
:::
::::

:::: {.grid}
::: {.g-col-4}
#### How to apply

Email James a 1-2 page research statement describing the project you would like to carry out.

:::
::: {.g-col-4}
#### How to apply

Graduate admissions are handled through a formal application to the department.
See the lab guide's [instructions for prospective graduate students](https://dossgollin-lab.github.io/lab-guide/joinus/gradadmissions.html){target=_blank}.
:::
::: {.g-col-4}
#### How to apply

If you're interested, please email a CV and 2-3 page research statement to James.
This research statement should clearly describe the project you would like to carry out, how it fits with our lab's expertise, what skillset you can bring to bear to the project, and what skills you would like to develop.
:::
